XXXX advised that I couldn't access my online account because my initial deposit hadn't yet hit the account, and to give it a couple days ; once my account was funded, I'd be able to access it. When I was still unable to access it on XX/XX/XXXX, I called again and spoke with CSR XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. He looked into it and couldn't determine what the problem was ; he said he would open a ticket with their tech department and he would call me back in 2-3 business days to let me know the status. I never heard from him again. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called again, this time requesting to speak to a manager. I was transferred to, and spoke with, XXXX XXXX ( her phone number is XXXX ). She also could not determine what the problem was in my accessing the account ; she said she would submit an expedited request with the tech team and she assured me that she would call me back by the end of that day. I never heard from her again. I left voice mail messages for XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX and never received a return call. As of this morning, I still can not access my online account, although two deposits have been made ( one of which is a payroll direct deposit ).

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
[ Date ] XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Inaccurate Personal Information Reporting by XXXX I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX Experian and XXXX regarding the refusal to correct inaccurate personal information on my credit report. Despite providing appropriate documentation, specifically a copy of my driver 's license as proof of my correct address, XXXX has failed to make the necessary corrections. 

I have recently noticed that my credit report with XXXX contains an erroneous address, which is negatively impacting my financial standing. As a responsible consumer, I understand the importance of accurate credit reporting and the significant role it plays in various aspects of my life, including obtaining credit, securing housing, and even employment opportunities. 

To rectify this issue, I followed prescribed procedure by submitting a written request along with a copy of my driver 's license, clearly indicating my correct address. Unfortunately, XXXX Experian and XXXX each rejected my request without any valid justification, leaving my credit report with incorrect information. 

The refusal to correct my personal information violates several consumer protection laws, including but not limited to : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under the FCRA, consumers have the right to dispute and request the correction of inaccurate information on their credit reports. Credit reporting agencies, such as XXXX, are legally obligated to investigate and correct any errors promptly. 

2. Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) : FACTA provides consumers with the right to obtain and dispute their credit reports. It requires credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate information and investigate disputed items within a reasonable timeframe. 

3. Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : The CFPA empowers the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to take appropriate action against financial institutions that engage in unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices, including inaccurate reporting of personal information. 

I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau intervene in this matter, investigate the actions of XXXX, and ensure that they comply with the aforementioned consumer protection laws. Additionally, I urge you to direct XXXX to correct my credit report promptly by updating my address to the accurate information provided. 


I appreciate your attention to this serious issue and request your prompt assistance in rectifying the inaccuracies on my credit report. I look forward to a favorable resolution and the restoration of my accurate personal information. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am disputing a charge of {$2100.00} to my XXXX Citibank Credit Card # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The charge is in error because the customer service representative reversed a charge on my account without my permission. I am seeking to get this charge removed from my account, that finance charges related to the disputed amount be credited to my account be removed, and that I get an accurate statement. 

I have contacted Citibank on several occasions to get this issue resolved : On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX Citibank Member Services, and the customer service representative reversed a previous credit without my permission. 
On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX in customer service, and he requested on audit on this charge. 
On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX and was told to wait XXXX business days, and I would see a credit on my account. That did not happen. 
On XX/XX/2023, I talked to XXXX and XXXX. XXXX told me to expect to see a credit on my account by XX/XX/2023. 
On XX/XX/2023, I received a letter from Citibank indicating they had permanently closed the dispute, and I had no further recourse. 

Enclosed are copies of the audit conducted by the dispute department at Citibank, veriyfing my claim that I had been charged twice for the item. The total balance should be {$2100.00}, not {$4200.00}. Citibank has yet to give me credit for the {$2100.00} due me. Interest is accruing on this item. My account is current on other items. 

Please do whatever is necessary to correct this issue.

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: I receive grants from the us government of treasury I deposited checks into my bank of America account everything was fine they cleared the checks in 3 days I was able to spend my money I'm not to sure about the dat but maybe XXXX the XXXX I went to a XXXX XXXX bank of America financial institution to do a wire also I was doing wires at bank of America in XXXX XXXX with no problem but the downtown institution started asking me question like where did the money come from so I explained they froze my account they sent me a letter in the mail saying I can no longer use my debit card or spend my money they told me that they were going to close my account XX/XX/XXXX and they told me that in the month of XXXX so I waited until XX/XX/XXXX and they didn't close it and said that they going to extend for more review so I called them after XX/XX/XXXX for the stats of my account and they kept giving me dates now it is XXXX they closed the account XX/XX/XXXX but said the funds will go into the back office for further review and bank of America told me there is no timeframe on when they will release the funds also they said that they are going to send money back to where the government checks came from which is the its but when I talked to the its XX/XX/XXXX they told me they are suppose to send to me my address which was on file the its also told me I should get a attorney I'm struggling just to make ends meet I'm behind on my bills because I was told by bank of America that they were going to close my account and send the money to my address but they just been lying to me I just need my money so I can move on thanks hope you can help

XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX SOC SEC XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX VT XXXX ATTENTION DISPUTE DEPARTMENT TODAYS DATE : XX/XX/XXXX This serves to notify you on the inaccurate information on my credit report as per your file. My Florida id and social security card was stolen. I have been disputing this charge and have proved that it was a fraudulent account I have also included a copy of the police report. I've been unnecessarily embarrassed by this oversight on your part or maybe your credit reporter 's part. The erroneous information below is not only degrading or defamatory. Consumer complaint narrative:
I was called and emailed a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX, claiming to represent Wells Fargo and attempting to collect a debt that was written off in 2015 in the amount of {$900.00}. They had my social security number, phone number and my current address and an old work address. 

When I told them I wanted a copy of the charges or what this was for, he started talking over me and told me Wells Fargo wouldnt speak to me, and if I didnt settle the account, Id be hearing from their lawyers. 

I did not bank with or have credit accounts with Wells Fargo in 2015.
